borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 768/L152 Rev. A; 768/L104 Rev. K; 768/L105 Rev. F; 768/L129 Rev. E; 768/L141 Rev. E; 768/L142 Rev. E; 768/L143 Rev. B; 768/L158 Rev. A; 768/L159 Rev. A; 768/L160 Rev. A.Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

The development shall be finished in external materials as shown on the approved drawing Nos. 768/L158 Rev. A; 768/L159 Rev. A; 768/L160 Rev. A., windows shall be aluminium in RAL colours: 7032, 7022 and 1021 as specified in the submitted details, and the materials used shall be in accordance with the submitted materials samples, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority. Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the development and in accordance with policy BP11 of the draft Local Development Framework: Borough Wide Development policies.

No development shall take place above ground level until there has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority a scheme of landscaping for the site which shall include indications of all existing trees, shrubs and hedgerows on the site and details of those to be retained.  The scheme shall also include details of the planting and design and layout of the nature area which shall be designed by a qualified Ecologist to maximise bio-diversity, and details shall be provided of nesting and roosting boxes for birds and bats respectively to be fixed to the building or the retained or proposed trees within the site, in accordance with advice set out in Biodiversity for Low and Zero Carbon Buildings: A Technical Guide for New Build (Publ. by RIBA, March 2010) or similar advice from the RSPB and the Bat Conservation Trust.  Reason: To safeguard and improve the appearance of the area and in order to comply with Section 197 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 and in accordance with policy BR3 of the Local Development Framework: Borough wide policies.

The approved soft landscaping scheme shall be carried out in the first planting and seeding seasons following the occupation of the building or completion of the development, whichever is the sooner, and the approved bird and bat boxes shall be installed prior to occupation of the building and thereafter maintained.   Any plants which within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season with others of similar size and species unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.Reason: To ensure the development is satisfactorily landscaped in order to improve the visual appearance of the area and to promote biodiversity and in accordance with policy BR3 of the Local Development Framework: Borough wide policies.

No development above ground level shall be commenced until a scheme showing those areas to be hard landscaped and the details of that hard landscaping have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing.  The scheme shall include details of bollards or other device to prevent unauthorised parking on the forecourt of the school building and shall include details of measures to protect the roots of tree Nos. T1, T2, T3, T4, T6, T7, and T8 (except any agreed for removal under condition 3 of this permission) which are all adjacent to proposed areas of hard standing.  The scheme as approved shall be carried out prior to the occupation of the development and thereafter permanently retained.Reason: To ensure the development is satisfactorily landscaped in order to improve the visual appearance of the area and in accordance with policy BP11 of the Local Development Framework: Borough wide policies.

Notwithstanding the approved list of drawings the subject of condition 1, no development above ground level shall take place until a scheme of car parking, vehicle circulation, and vehicle servicing for the site has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The proposed main car park to the south of the site shall be designed to minimise its impact on the residential amenities of neighbouring residents.  The car parking and circulation areas shall be completed in accordance with the approved drawings prior to the occupation of the development and thereafter maintained for this purpose.Reason: To ensure that sufficient off-street parking areas are provided and not to prejudice the free flow of traffic on the adjoining highway, and to maintain a good standard of residential amenity in accordance with policies BR4 and BP8 of the Local Development Framework: Borough wide policies.

The blue badge parking bays approved in connection with the approved parking scheme the subject of condition 6 shall be clearly marked with a British Standard disabled symbol and permanently retained for the use of disabled persons and their vehicles and for no other purpose.Reason: To ensure and promote easier access for disabled persons to the approved building in accordance with Policy BP11 of the draft Local Development Framework: Borough Wide Development policies.

Covered cycle parking facilities as shown on drawing no. 768/L152 Rev. A shall be installed prior to the occupation of the building and thereafter maintained, unless any variation is agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: In order to ensure that adequate cycle parking is provided in order to encourage cycling as a sustainable form of transport and in accordance with policy BR11 of the Local Development Framework: Borough wide policies.

No development above ground level shall be commenced until details of all boundary fences and walls have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and no part of the development shall be occupied until the approved fences and walls for that part have been provided.  The approved fences and walls shall be retained unless the Local Planning Authority gives prior written approval to their removal.Reason: To ensure the satisfactory means of enclosure for the proposed development in the interests of the security of the development and the visual amenity of the area and in accordance with policy BP11 of the Local Development Framework: Borough wide policies.

The requirements and recommendations of the Arboricultural Method Statement set out in Appendix 9 of the submitted Aboricultural Impact Assessment shall be carried out in full throughout the duration of the construction work.Reason: In order to protect the health of the retained trees and in accordance with policy BR3 of the Local Development Framework: Borough wide policies.

All tree works including felling, where approved, shall take place outside the bird nesting season (February to September).  Where this is not possible an inspection must be carried out by a qualified ecologist not more than 3 days before the work.  If no evidence of nesting birds is found work may proceed. If evidence of nesting birds is found, works to the tree in question must not take place, and details of the inspection must be submitted to the local planning authority.  Work to any such tree may only proceed after the nests have been permanently vacated for the season, and a further inspection by a qualified ecologist shall be carried out not more than 3 days before the work commences, and work shall not proceed unless the qualified ecologist confirms that the nests have been vacated.  Details of the inspection shall be submitted to the local planning authority.Reason: In order to prevent harm to protected species and in accordance with policy BR3 of the Local Development Framework: Borough wide policies.

No development above ground level shall begin until a surface water drainage scheme for the site, based on sustainable drainage principles and an assessment of the hydrological and hydro geological context of the development, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme shall subsequently be implemented in accordance with the approved details before the development is occupied. Reason: To prevent the increased risk of flooding, to improve and protect water quality, improve habitat and amenity, and to ensure the future maintenance of the system and in accordance with policy BR4 of the Local Development Framework: Borough wide policies.

Before the commencement of any development above ground level an energy strategy shall be submitted to the local planning authority.  The strategy shall demonstrate compliance with policy BR2 of the Local Development Framework: Borough wide policies, and shall achieve a minimum 41.5% reduction in carbon emissions compared to a scheme designed in accordance with the Building Regulations 2006 and not incorporating renewable energy.  The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved details and the strategy shall thereafter be maintained.Reason: In order to ensure that the development contributes to targets to reduce carbon dioxide emissions and that it complies with the requirements of the outline planning permission and in accordance with policy BR2 of the Local Development Framework: Borough wide policies.

The development shall be constructed in accordance with the submitted BREEAM Education Pre-Assessment report and shall achieve a minimum BREEAM rating of Excellent.  A certificated BREEAM Post Construction Review, or other verification process agreed with the Local Planning Authority, shall be provided, confirming that the agreed standards have been met.  The Review shall be submitted between 12 and 13 months following the first occupation of the development unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure that the proposed development is constructed in an environmentally sustainable manner and in accordance with BR1 of the Local Development Framework: Borough wide policies.

No external construction works, deliveries, external running of plant and equipment or internal works audible outside the site boundary shall take place on the site other than between the hours of 0800 to 1800 on Monday to Friday and 0800 to 1300 on Saturday and not at all on Sundays, Public or Bank Holidays without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure that the proposed construction work does not cause undue nuisance and disturbance to neighbouring properties at unreasonable hours and in accordance with BR4 of the Local Development Framework: Borough wide policies.

No development above ground level shall commence until a scheme showing the provisions to be made for external lighting, CCTV coverage, access control, and any other measures to reduce the risk of crime, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The scheme shall include details of lighting to the car parks which shall be designed to minimise light spillage and its impact on the adjacent dwellings and shall be switched off when the building is not in use.  The scheme shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details and shall thereafter be permanently retained unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: In the interests of enhancing security and safety, and protecting residential amenity and in accordance with policies BC7 and BP8 of the Local Development Framework: Borough Wide Development policies.

No development above ground level shall begin until the local planning authority has approved in writing a full scheme for the provision of the two proposed vehicular access points serving the site.  The occupation of the development shall not begin until those works have been completed in accordance with the local planning authority's approval and have been certified in writing as complete by or on behalf of the local planning authority.Reason: In order to ensure the provision of a satisfactory access to the development in the interests of highway safety and in accordance with policy BR10 of the Local Development Framework: Borough wide policies.

The school site shall not be open to the public or used for any private functions or events or activities between the hours of 2200 and 0700 on any day, except that between 2200 and 2230 the associated cleaning and securing of the site may take place following an event finishing at 2200.	Reason: In order to protect the amenities of neighbouring residents by preventing any activities which could cause a noise nuisance at unsociable hours and in accordance with policy BP8 of the Local Development Framework: Borough wide policies.

The building hereby permitted shall not be occupied until there has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority a Travel Plan for the site which shall include proposals for minimising car-borne travel and encouraging walking, cycling and the use of public transport.  The approved Travel Plan shall be implemented and monitored in accordance with the approved scheme.Reason:  In order to encourage the use of sustainable transport and in accordance with policy BR10 of the Local Development Framework: Borough wide policies.
description: Application for approval of reserved matters following outline approval (Ref: 06/01284/OUT): Erection of single/two storey primary school together with associated car parking areas.
